articles.headline: A Generation Grows Up in China Without Google, Facebook or Twitter
articles.snippet: Many foreign internet giants are blocked, leaving some young Chinese to wonder what those services even are — and reinforcing Beijing’s ideological control.
articles.abstract: Many foreign internet giants are blocked, leaving some young Chinese to wonder what those services even are — and reinforcing Beijing’s ideological control.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Wei Dilong, 18, who lives in the southern Chinese city of Liuzhou, likes basketball, hip-hop music and Hollywood superhero movies. He plans to study chemistry in Canada when he goes to college in 2020.

articles.headline: Rick Gates Testifies He Committed Crimes With Paul Manafort
articles.snippet: For decades, Mr. Gates was right-hand man to Mr. Manafort, the former Trump campaign chairman who is accused of tax and bank fraud.
articles.abstract: For decades, Mr. Gates was right-hand man to Mr. Manafort, the former Trump campaign chairman who is accused of tax and bank fraud.
articles.lead_paragraph: Updated Aug. 7, 2018: Rick Gates is on the stand for a second day to testify against Paul Manafort. Follow our live briefing for the latest developments.
articles.byline: By Sharon LaFraniere and Kenneth P. Vogel

articles.headline: Alcoa Requests Reprieve From Trump’s Aluminum Tariffs
articles.snippet: The company, which imports much of its aluminum from its facilities in Canada, asked the administration for an exemption.
articles.abstract: The company, which imports much of its aluminum from its facilities in Canada, asked the administration for an exemption.
articles.lead_paragraph: Get the DealBook newsletter to make sense of major business and policy headlines — and the power-brokers who shape them.__________
articles.byline: By Peter Eavis and Jim Tankersley

articles.headline: When a Female C.E.O. Leaves, the Glass Ceiling Is Restored
articles.snippet: Even at companies run by prominent women — where it seems that gender diversity has made great strides — why is a female leader hardly ever replaced by another woman?
articles.abstract: Even at companies run by prominent women — where it seems that gender diversity has made great strides — why is a female leader hardly ever replaced by another woman?

articles.headline: A Top Syrian Scientist Is Killed, and Fingers Point at Israel
articles.snippet: The car bombing was said to be at least the fourth Israeli assassination attempt against an enemy weapons engineer on foreign soil in the last three years.
articles.abstract: The car bombing was said to be at least the fourth Israeli assassination attempt against an enemy weapons engineer on foreign soil in the last three years.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Aziz Asbar was one of Syria’s most important rocket scientists, bent on amassing an arsenal of precision-guided missiles that could be launched with pinpoint accuracy against Israeli cities hundreds of miles away.
articles.byline: By David M. Halbfinger and Ronen Bergman

articles.headline: No, Tariffs Aren’t Going to Pay Down the National Debt
articles.snippet: The budget deficit is growing much faster than any increase in tariff revenue.
articles.abstract: The budget deficit is growing much faster than any increase in tariff revenue.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Trump has a new plan for how to pay down the national debt: Taxing American consumers and businesses when they buy certain goods from countries subject to his tariffs.

articles.headline: A Dream Ended on a Mountain Road: The Cyclists and the ISIS Militants
articles.snippet: Two American cyclists had a vision of the world, or, at least, what it could be. The men who mowed them down in Tajikistan had a starkly different one.
articles.abstract: Two American cyclists had a vision of the world, or, at least, what it could be. The men who mowed them down in Tajikistan had a starkly different one.
articles.lead_paragraph: Asked why they had quit their office jobs and set off on a biking journey around the world, the young American couple offered a simple explanation: They had grown tired of the meetings and teleconferences, of the time sheets and password changes.
